metadata.Title: CVE-2015-8870 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Integer overflow in tools/bmp2tiff.c in LibTIFF before 4.0.4 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (heap-based buffer over-read), or possibly obtain sensitive information from process memory, via crafted width and length values in RLE4 or RLE8 data in a BMP file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8870` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtiff-opengl - 4.0.6-1
libtiff-tools - 4.0.6-1
libtiff5 - 4.0.6-1
libtiffxx5 - 4.0.6-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> upstream removed the bmp2tiff utility in 4.0.7 fixed by CVE-2014-81xx-1.patch in Ubuntu

criterions.comment: tiff package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.0.6-1').
